        To check if the inner linkedhashmap has multiple dates. This can happen is this java.sql.date was not directly created from sql fetch query and instead was created from a timestamp object. If the java.sql.Date is created from timestamp object then the time component still remains in the Date object thus can cause multiple Date objects with same dates (but different times).

      • getEditDistanceLeastDistantSubcand

        public static Triple<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getEditDistanceLeastDistantSubcand(Timeline candidateDayTimeline,
                                                                                                             java.util.ArrayList<ActivityObject> activitiesGuidingRecomm,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String userAtRecomm,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String dateAtRecomm,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String timeAtRecomm,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String candidateID,
                                                                                                             boolean hasInvalidActivityNames,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String invalidActName1,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String invalidActName2,
                                                                                                             java.lang.String distanceUsed,
                                                                                                             HJEditDistance hjEditDistance)
        Get distance scores using modified edit distance. The distance score is the distance between the activities guiding recommendation and the least distant subcandidate (which has a valid activity after it) from the candidate timeline. (subcandidate is a subsequence from candidate timeline, from the start of the candidate timeline to any occurrence of the ActivityGuiding Recomm or current activity).
        Parameters:
        candidateDayTimeline - currently a day timeline. It should not be TimelineWithNext, because instead of timeline 'with next' here the subsequence must have a valid act after it or else not considered. This valid act after the subsequence essentially served as "the next" activity to recommend.
        activitiesGuidingRecomm -
        userAtRecomm -
        dateAtRecomm - only used for writing to file
        timeAtRecomm - only used for writing to file
        candidateID -
        hasInvalidActivityNames -
        invalidActName1 -
        invalidActName2 -
        distanceUsed -
        HJEditDistance -
        Returns:
        Triple{EndIndexOfLestDistantSubCand,TraceOfEditOperation,EditDistance}
